verses.verse: And the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> again <WH3254> did <WH6213> that which was evil <WH7451> in the sight <WH5869> of Jehovah <WH3068>, when Ehud <WH164> was dead <WH4191>.

And Jehovah <WH3068> sold <WH4376> them into the hand <WH3027> of Jabin <WH2985> king <WH4428> of Canaan <WH3667>, that reigned <WH4427> in Hazor <WH2674>; the captain <WH8269> of whose host <WH6635> was Sisera <WH5516>, who lived <WH3427> in Harosheth <WH2800> of the Nations <WH1471>.

And the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> cried <WH6817> unto Jehovah <WH3068>: for he had nine <WH8672> hundred <WH3967> chariots <WH7393> of iron <WH1270>; and twenty <WH6242> years <WH8141> he mightily <WH2394> oppressed <WH3905> the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478>.
Now Deborah <WH1683>, a prophetess <WH5031>, the wife <WH802> of Lappidoth <WH3941>, she judged <WH8199> Israel <WH3478> at that time <WH6256>.

And she lived <WH3427> under the palm-tree <WH8560> of Deborah <WH1683> between Ramah <WH7414> and Beth-el <WH1008> in the hill-country <WH2022> of Ephraim <WH669>: and the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> came up <WH5927> to her for judgment <WH4941>.

And she sent <WH7971> and called <WH7121> Barak <WH1301> the son <WH1121> of Abinoam <WH42> out of Kedesh-naphtali <WH6943>, and said <WH559> unto him <WH3068>, Has not Jehovah, the God <WH430> of Israel <WH3478>, commanded <WH6680>, saying <WH3212>, Go and draw <WH4900> unto mountain <WH2022> Tabor <WH8396>, and take <WH3947> with you ten <WH6235> thousand <WH505> men <WH376> of the sons <WH1121> of Naphtali <WH5321> and of the sons <WH1121> of Zebulun <WH2074>?

And I will draw <WH4900> unto you <WH5158>, to the river Kishon <WH7028>, Sisera <WH5516>, the captain <WH8269> of Jabin <WH2985>'s army <WH6635>, with his chariots <WH7393> and his multitude <WH1995>; and I will deliver <WH5414> him into your hand <WH3027>.
And Barak <WH1301> said <WH559> unto her <WH3212>, If you will go with me <WH1980>, then I will go; but if you will not go <WH3212> with me <WH3212>, I will not go.

And she said <WH559>, I will surely <WH1980> go <WH3212> with you <WH657>: nevertheless, the journey <WH1870> that you take <WH1980> shall not be for your honor <WH8597>; for Jehovah <WH3068> will sell <WH4376> Sisera <WH5516> into the hand <WH3027> of a woman <WH802>. And Deborah <WH1683> arose <WH6965>, and went <WH3212> with Barak <WH1301> to Kedesh <WH6943>.

And Barak <WH1301> called <WH2199> Zebulun <WH2074> and Naphtali <WH5321> together to Kedesh <WH6943>; and there went up <WH5927> ten <WH6235> thousand <WH505> men <WH376> at his feet <WH7272>: and Deborah <WH1683> went up with him <WH5927>.

Now Heber <WH2268> the Kenite <WH7017> had separated <WH6504> himself from the Kenites <WH7017>, even from the sons <WH1121> of Hobab <WH2246> the brother-in <WH2859>-law of Moses <WH4872>, and had pitched <WH5186> his tent <WH168> as far as the oak <WH436> in Zaanannim <WH6815>, which is by Kedesh <WH6943>.
And they told <WH5046> Sisera <WH5516> that Barak <WH1301> the son <WH1121> of Abinoam <WH42> was gone up <WH5927> to mountain <WH2022> Tabor <WH8396>.

And Sisera <WH5516> gathered together <WH2199> all his chariots <WH7393>, even nine <WH8672> hundred <WH3967> chariots <WH7393> of iron <WH1270>, and all the people <WH5971> that were with him <WH2800>, from Harosheth of the Nations <WH1471>, unto the river <WH5158> Kishon <WH7028>.

And Deborah <WH1683> said <WH559> unto Barak <WH1301>, Up <WH6965>; for this is the day <WH3117> in which Jehovah <WH3068> has delivered <WH5414> Sisera <WH5516> into your hand <WH3027>; is not Jehovah <WH3068> gone out <WH3318> before <WH6440> you <WH1301>? So Barak went down <WH3381> from mountain <WH2022> Tabor <WH8396>, and ten <WH6235> thousand <WH505> men <WH376> after him <WH310>.

And Jehovah <WH3068> defeated <WH2000> Sisera <WH5516>, and all his chariots <WH7393>, and all his host <WH4264>, with the edge <WH6310> of the sword <WH2719> before <WH6440> Barak <WH1301>; and Sisera <WH5516> alighted from <WH3381> his chariot <WH4818>, and fled away <WH5127> on his feet <WH7272>.

But Barak <WH1301> pursued <WH7291> after <WH310> the chariots <WH7393>, and after the host <WH4264>, unto Harosheth <WH2800> of the Nations <WH1471>: and all the host <WH4264> of Sisera <WH5516> fell <WH5307> by the edge <WH6310> of the sword <WH2719>; there was not a man <WH259> left <WH7604>.

But Sisera <WH5516> fled away <WH5127> on his feet <WH7272> to the tent <WH168> of Jael <WH3278> the wife <WH802> of Heber <WH2268> the Kenite <WH7017>; for there was peace <WH7965> between Jabin <WH2985> the king <WH4428> of Hazor <WH2674> and the house <WH1004> of Heber <WH2268> the Kenite <WH7017>.

And Jael <WH3278> went out <WH3318> to meet <WH7125> Sisera <WH5516>, and said <WH559> unto him <WH5493>, Turn in, my lord <WH113>, turn in <WH5493> to me <WH3372>; fear not <WH5493>. And he turned in unto her into the tent <WH168>, and she covered <WH3680> him with a rug <WH8063>.

And he said <WH559> unto her <WH4592>, Give me, I pray you, a little water <WH4325> to drink <WH8248>; for I am thirsty <WH6770>. And she opened <WH6605> a bottle <WH4997> of milk <WH2461>, and gave him drink <WH8248>, and covered him <WH3680>.

And he said <WH559> unto her <WH5975>, Stand in the door <WH6607> of the tent <WH168>, and it shall be <WH376>, when any man does come <WH935> and inquire <WH7592> of you <WH559>, and say, Is there <WH3426> any man <WH376> here <WH3426>? that you shall say <WH559>, No.

Then Jael <WH3278> Heber <WH2268>'s wife <WH802> took <WH3947> a tent <WH168> - pin <WH3489>, and took <WH7760> a hammer <WH4718> in her hand <WH3027>, and went <WH935> softly <WH3814> unto him <WH8628>, and struck the pin <WH3489> into his temples <WH7541>, and it pierced through into <WH6795> the ground <WH776>; for he was in a deep sleep <WH7290>; so he swooned <WH5774> and died <WH4191>.

And <WH1301>, behold, as Barak pursued <WH7291> Sisera <WH5516>, Jael <WH3278> came out <WH3318> to meet <WH7125> him <WH559>, and said unto him <WH3212>, Come, and I will show <WH7200> you the man <WH376> whom you seek <WH1245>. And he came <WH935> unto her <WH5516>; and, behold, Sisera lay <WH5307> dead <WH4191>, and the tent-pin <WH3489> was in his temples <WH7541>.
So God <WH430> subdued <WH3665> on that day <WH3117> Jabin <WH2985> the king <WH4428> of Canaan <WH3667> before <WH6440> the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478>.

And the hand <WH3027> of the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> prevailed <WH7186> more <WH3212> and more against Jabin <WH2985> the king <WH4428> of Canaan <WH3667>, until they had destroyed <WH3772> Jabin <WH2985> king <WH4428> of Canaan <WH3667>.
